definition: moral (of a story)/lesson to be learned/implication/message/import/metaphorical meaning
to reside/to imply/to contain/residence
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
to have profound import (idiom); to be deeply significant
the implied message is deep (idiom); having deep implications

sentences.english: The "Crane Dance"for a long life and the "Peacock Dance"for happiness and beauty.
sentences.chinese: 鶴舞寓意長壽，孔雀舞寓意幸福與美麗。

sentences.english: The "Crane Dance"for a long life and the "Peacock Dance"for happiness and beauty.
sentences.chinese: 鶴舞寓意長壽，孔雀舞寓意幸福與美麗。

sentences.english: Serving desserts brings a sweet life in the new year.
sentences.chinese: 春節期間喫甜食，寓意新年甜甜蜜蜜。

sentences.english: The restaurant offers dishes especially for Chinese New Year.
sentences.chinese: 餐廳提供寓意吉祥的賀年美食。

sentences.english: Mythology adds a richness of detail and a concreteness to metaphorical language.
sentences.chinese: 神話故事增加了大量的細節描述和一個寓意。

sentences.english: The courser in the picture means succeeding immediately upon its arrival.
sentences.chinese: 圖中的駿馬寓意着“馬到成功”。

sentences.english: It's a quite profound story, with powerful religious overtones.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事寓意深遠，具有強烈的宗教色彩。

sentences.english: The peaches in his paintings are always in even number, meaning that good things always come in double.
sentences.chinese: 壽桃的數量也是畫雙不畫單，包含了好事成雙的寓意。

sentences.english: All Van Gogh's pictures from this time became biographical notes loaded with meaning.
sentences.chinese: 梵高在這段時期的作品都是飽含寓意的自傳式筆記。

sentences.english: Yun Shouping also had a congenial line in veiled political comment.
sentences.chinese: 惲壽平也曾在一句寓意詩中委婉地表達政治見解。

sentences.english: Such an act is also a representation of a self-commitment to realize their dream.
sentences.chinese: 這動作寓意爲自己實踐夢想的一種承諾。

sentences.english: The tension or suspense is: what will the moral be?
sentences.chinese: 而這個張力和懸念是，那會是個什麼寓意？

sentences.english: This is a play that packs message.
sentences.chinese: 這是一出寓意深刻的戲。

sentences.english: Hoist the plant, for long stretches the vines generations.
sentences.chinese: 葫蘆本爲藤本植物，藤蔓綿延則寓意萬代綿長。

sentences.english: The message of the story was—you're never too old to learn.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事的寓意是“活到老學到老”。

definition: lucky/auspicious/propitious
emblem/symbol/token/badge/to symbolize/to signify/to stand for
homonym/homophone/harmonic (component of sound)
lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
complimentary remarks/well-wishing
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
the implied message is deep (idiom); having deep implications
the more sons, the more happiness (idiom)
metaphor
good luck and long life
the dragon and phoenix are symbols of good fortune (idiom)/auspicious/decorated with auspicious symbols such as the dragon and the phoenix
We wish you long life and riches! (idiom, conventional greeting)
auspicious sign
long-lived people, rich harvests (idiom); stable and affluent society/prosperity
inner meaning/implication/connotation
